Comment: What do you expect? These people are everywhere. They might not be as far along the same road, but those "populist" and "anti-immigration" parties across Europe are just the same old proto-fascists they always were, and most of the so-called moderate right is as willing as ever to make common cause with them if that means they can keep pushing their pet socioeconomic policies.  Some countries, like the UK, are especially vulnerable to this because you essentially get absolute power based on a plurality of the vote, whereas in most other countries you need to set up some kind of coalition and power sharing arrangement.

Author: saiyanscaris

Comment: I get what you're trying to say, but I would say that before thinking about fixing any international relationships, you need to fix your country. At the present time things are looking extremely dire from the other side of the Atlantic, with the executive branch arresting judges and the shadow of a police state looming, on top of continuing threats to the sovereignty of some of our allies, which many Americans seem to be able to dismiss easily. Be sure that we do not. I find it interesting that people here are still questioning if some countries are still the US' allies, when a huge portion of the Canadian population, for one, has been considering the US not just as "no longer an ally", but as an *enemy* for a while now. And we're talking about freaking Canadians here.  And it's going to get much worse before (if?) it gets better. Trump is sounding more and more like a dictator every day. This is not the kind of country the EU and UK could -- or should -- trust. Your country is so far removed from what it was mere months ago that it seems it may be too much for Americans to take in, being in the middle of it. It's possible you lack perspective
Author: Acrobatic-Stoat

Comment: Remember the BNP? Same people different party.
Author: Sinocatk

Comment: I was saying that we need to fix our country first, and that's why it would take decades. Say republicans get crushed in midterms, and Trump loses emphatically in 4 years.  We are still a country that within as soon as four years could turn around and backstab all of our allies again. Even if we rid ourselves of Trump tomorrow europe, the five eyes, Mexico, etc will not be able to trust us for a long time to come.  You are spot on about how it's too much for Americans to take in. Many Americans live extremely americentric lives and have never heard any media that's not American or talk to anyone who is not american. They absolutely do not understand that the post war world we have spent our entire lives in, has been changed forever.
Author: The_Navy_Sox
